pros: Coworkers are friendly and fun to work with
cons: Work environment is stressful at times.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Columbia, SC
pros: CCH could be an awesome place to work. The employees (Nurses, Tech, Monitor techs, RTs etc) are awesome, which is why I stuck around. We're really a team. RT's have a good bit of autonomy. There are mostly vented trach patients but we get ETT's some as well. Management only cares about themselves. The staff is overworked and although the pay is pretty good it's not enough for what we deal with. I'm wondering how long it will take management to learn what it takes to retain employees? It's like a revolving door...especially for techs.
cons: Understaffed No bonus for extra shifts

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Columbia, SC
pros: Critical care skills education and application

job_title: Licensed Vocational Nurse in Charlotte, NC
pros: Most patients admitted to the unit were of a high acuity which really kept me on my toes, helped brush up on my skills and strengthen others
cons: Dedicated staff, clean environment and get locations
Not enough staff to cover shift

review_title: Good job for those with the heart to do it.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Abilene, TX
cons: often understaffed due to CNA's coming and going

pros: Good learning experiences working with trach-vent patients, and others with multiple co-morbid conditions.  A great respiratory team.  Wonderful nursing staff that are ready to help one another.
cons: Working short staffed is common with  patient  acuity levels being quite high at times.  Hard work but rewarding.

pros: Opportunity to work with medically complex patients, which enables nurse to sharpen their skills and broaden their clinical knowledge.  Great group of nurses and the manager is awesome.
cons: Often times the nursing role is very demanding and requires a lot of attention to the patients and families.  The workload assignment is the biggest obstacle for me personally..

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Pineville, NC
pros: Nice new facility. Pay is competitive. Good employees to work with.
cons: Short staff, supplies are behind a lot. Management in some of the departments needs to be changed.

review_title: Worked with good and bad people
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kings Mountain, NC
pros: Good team, pay is ok, not so crazy all the time, facility is new, management fair, Dr are helpful, and pto good
cons: Short staffed, favoritism can be an issue, vacation time was difficult due to finding help, good workers for some reason were being let go and health insurance very expensive
